Description: Tondo sherd of Attic black-figured pottery little master cup; interior, from outside; glazed area; band of alternating black and added red tongues with added white dots on interstices, between quadruple glaze bands; in tondo, black-figure decoration consisting of a collapsing or gallopping deer or horse (forelegs and under belly remaining; with red and white on under belly) to right; exterior: glazed black.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For a parallel regarding the pattern decoration, see Cambridge Fitzwilliam GR.204.1899.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 419, no. B653, pl. CCVI)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1333) (phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
